page.title: 02THE CLIMATE OF HARVEL
page.content: Harvel weather feels cold and wet but is considered to be healthy. Mist, rain and sleet are frequent, snow heavy and lying long in bad winters.Late springs and early frosts are the rule. The general elevation of between 400 and 600 ft, the high percentage of tree cover and Holly Hill's prominent position above the Medway Gap suggest a vulnerability to cloud and thunder gathering. Excessive wind exposure is not complained of, perhaps due to shelter from the tree cover. No data is available but a phone call or trip away often confirms Harvel's extreme conditions. Spring growth reflects the lower air and ground temperatures normal on a North slope. Conditions resemble a Northern county rather than the South-East.
